title: Centre flays X over 'censorship' claim, says platform delayed unblocking accounts
content: India has refuted X's claims that it ordered the blocking of international news channels like @Reuters and @ReutersWorld. The ministry of electronics and information technology clarified that it promptly requested X to unblock the accounts when they were initially restricted. The government criticized X for the delay in restoring access, emphasizing that it took over 21 hours despite continuous follow-ups.

title: Milan airport horror: Man dies after being sucked into aircraft's engine
content: A man, believed to be around 35, tragically died after being sucked into a plane engine at Milan Bergamo Airport. He breached security, accessing the aircraft parking zones after abandoning his car near the terminal. Authorities have confirmed he was neither a passenger nor airport staff.

title: Exclusive | 'I became India No. 1 but wasn’t serious professionally': 16-yoTanvi
content: Sixteen-year-old Tanvi Sharma, a badminton player from Punjab, made history at the US Open 2025, becoming the youngest Indian to reach a BWF World Tour Final. Despite losing to Beiwen Zhang, Sharma's impressive run, defeating higher-ranked opponents, inspires many. She balances rigorous training with her studies, fueled by her mother's support.

title: Rocket shocker: US Air Force halts SpaceX project; Reason same as why Musk skipped omelette …
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: Watch: What's brewing? Gambhir, India staff spotted in intense inspection of Lord's pitch
content: Ahead of the crucial Lord's Test, the green pitch has sparked intense speculation. Coach Gautam Gambhir and his staff meticulously analyzed the surface, hinting at a strategy favoring India's pace bowlers. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak acknowledged the green tinge, anticipating an advantage for pacers ahead of the 3rd Test on Thursday.

title: Watch: Philadelphia mass shooting caught on camera
content: A mass shooting in Philadelphia claimed the lives of Zahir Wylie, Jason Reese, and Azir Harris, while injuring ten others, including a 15-year-old girl. Surveillance footage captured multiple gunmen firing indiscriminately on South Etting Street. Police are investigating the incident, which occurred amidst a weekend of widespread violence across the city, leaving authorities and community leaders condemning the senseless act.

title: Trump’s message to Elon Musk: US President pens long note; ‘I’m saddened to see Elon go …’
content: Donald Trump has publicly criticised Elon Musk for his plan to form a new political party, dubbed the 'American Party,' expressing disappointment and describing Musk's recent behaviour as a 'train wreck.' Trump opposes third parties, citing potential chaos, and suggests Musk's actions stem from the elimination of the Electric Vehicle Mandate in a recently passed bill, despite Musk's prior endorsement.

title: Kolkata gang rape case: Court sends 4 accused to 14-day judicial custody
content: Alipore Court remanded the four accused, including prime suspect Monojit Mishra, in the South Calcutta Law College gang rape case to 14 days of judicial custody. Kolkata Police's detective department is investigating discrepancies in the attendance register. Meanwhile, SFI activists protested outside a Howrah college, demanding action against TMCP leader Souvik Roy for allegedly mistreating first-year students.

title: Anand rates D Gukesh's Norway Chess showing: 'He deserved a D'
content: Despite a mixed run after his world championship win, Gukesh D showed resilience at Norway Chess, securing a notable victory against Magnus Carlsen. His long-time mentor, Viswanathan Anand, upgraded Gukesh's performance assessment, acknowledging his resourcefulness. Anand highlighted areas for improvement, particularly decision-making in games. Gukesh currently leads the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz Croatia 2025, demonstrating his ongoing competitive spirit.

title: Bill Gates out of world’s 10 richest man list: His net worth falls 30% in 7 days
content: Bill Gates has fallen out of the top ten richest people due to a recalculation reflecting his significant charitable donations. His net worth decreased by $52 billion, moving him to twelfth place, while Steve Ballmer, his former assistant and Microsoft's ex-CEO, now ranks higher with $172 billion.

title: Years of inaction, minutes of terror: Over 100 dead in Texas flood
content: Kerr County faces scrutiny after a devastating flash flood claimed over 100 lives during the Fourth of July weekend. A CNN investigation reveals the county's failure to implement basic emergency alert systems, despite repeated warnings and available funding. The lack of sirens and real-time communication with the National Weather Service contributed to the tragedy, prompting criticism of systemic inaction and avoidable loss of life.

title: 'He got tired of that BBL smell': Cardi B deletes Stefon Diggs pics; fans slam rapper
content: Cardi B has sparked breakup rumors with Stefon Diggs by deleting all their photos together from her Instagram. Just weeks after their romantic getaways, including a stay in a French castle, fans noticed the sudden disappearance of Diggs from her social media. A cryptic post from Paris further fueled speculation, leaving fans wondering if the whirlwind romance is over.

title: Colin Kaepernick: 'I'm not quitting'—daily training for NFL comeback
content: Colin Kaepernick, now 37, declares his readiness to return to the NFL after an eight-year absence. Despite last playing in 2017, he maintains a rigorous training schedule and believes he can still be a starting quarterback. Kaepernick awaits an opportunity, remaining optimistic that the right team will call, even after years away from the game.

title: Dayton Bramhall cut again — legacy Disney daughter’s emotional Netflix journey
content: Dayton Bramhall, daughter of Shelly, faced challenges in her DCC journey. She auditioned thrice but was cut each time. Despite her family's DCC legacy, she needed to earn her place. The rejection strained relationships, especially with her mother. Dayton now teaches at The Young Company in Texas. She empowers young dancers with her experiences.

title: 'Let them arrest me': Mah min defies own govt; joins MNS protest in Thane
content: Maharashtra witnessed a clash between political factions and the state government as a Marathi rally in Mira Road was denied permission, sparking protests. Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik criticized the decision and joined the demonstration, defying potential arrest. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis condemned the MNS for disregarding police instructions, emphasizing the importance of following protocol for public safety and traffic management.

title: Aamir says he's already married to Gauri Spratt in his heart: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Bobby Darling revealed John Abraham ghosted her, while Aamir Khan confirmed his Mahabharat project with fresh faces starting in August. Khan also expressed he feels married to Gauri Spratt in his heart. Anurag Basu remains hopeful about his Kishore Kumar biopic, and Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana has already generated ₹1,000 crore in market value with just its first look.

title: 'Cricket not as intimidating as ...': Kohli on Wimbledon experience - Watch
content: Virat Kohli, attending Wimbledon, expressed that playing cricket, even in packed stadiums, is less intimidating than competing on Wimbledon's Centre Court. He highlighted the immense pressure tennis players face, especially in crucial matches and praised their composure, fitness, and mental fortitude. Kohli drew parallels to the India-Pakistan World Cup games, acknowledging the intense pressure in both sports.

title: CBI busts cyber fraud syndicate: UK, Australia citizens targeted; key operative arrested in Noida
content: The CBI, under Operation Chakra-V, dismantled a cybercrime syndicate in Noida, arresting Nishant Walia of FirstIdea. The group allegedly defrauded UK and Australian citizens through tech support scams, posing as representatives from companies like Microsoft. Raids uncovered a fake call center and evidence of international collaboration, highlighting the global reach of cybercrime.

title: 'Many of you will be future astronauts': Shubhanshu Shukla speaks to students from ISS
content: During his ISS mission, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla connected with students from Meghalaya and Assam via Ham radio from NESAC, Shillong. He addressed their questions about life in space, training, and health in microgravity, highlighting the challenges of adapting to weightlessness and the importance of exercise and teamwork. Shukla also discussed the role of robotics in assisting astronauts with their tasks.

title: 'Jokes are my right': Kamra responds defiantly after notice by Maha privilege committee
content: Kunal Kamra faces a show cause notice from Maharashtra legislature's privileges committee for allegedly insulting deputy CM Eknath Shinde in a parody song. Kamra responded defiantly, asserting his right to joke. Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sushma Andhare also received a notice for supporting Kamra.

title: Trade war: China warns nations against siding with US on supply chain shifts
content: China has cautioned the US against reimposing tariffs, warning of retaliation against nations aligning with Washington to exclude Beijing from global supply chains. The warning, published in the People's Daily, criticizes the US tariff strategy as "bullying."

title: Drug row: Kollywood actors Srikanth and Krishna get conditional bail in high-profile case
content: Kollywood actors Srikanth and Krishna were arrested in Chennai after cocaine traces were found in medical tests. The Madras High Court granted them conditional bail. Investigations continue, with authorities probing drug links. Srikanth and Krishna are known for notable Tamil films, including 'Manasellam' and 'Kazhugu', respectively.

title: ITR filing FY 2024-25: New versus old income tax regime - what helps you save more tax?
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Choosing the right income tax regime is crucial for ITR filing. Salaried taxpayers can choose between the new and old regimes annually. The new regime has undergone revisions, making it more appealing. Tax slabs differ significantly between the regimes. Here is a comparison to make an informed choice:

title: 'Pant is the Indian Afridi': Former Pakistan captain makes huge claim
content: Former Pakistan captain Mushtaq Mohammad, who was born in Gujarat before migrating to Karachi, expressed his longing to revisit his birthplace, Junagadh. Despite visa challenges and past scheduling conflicts, the 81-year-old fondly remembers his connections to India, including his friendship with Bishan Singh Bedi, who significantly influenced his leg-spin bowling.

title: Tamil Nadu school van tragedy: DMK blames language barrier for accident
content: A tragic school van collision in Tamil Nadu resulted in the death of three students, sparking political controversy. The DMK alleges a language barrier involving the railway gateman, who purportedly didn't understand Tamil, contributed to the accident. Southern Railway claims the gate was closed, but the driver and a student insist it was open.

title: Pettis Norman dies at 86: NFL legend mourned in silence
content: Former Dallas Cowboys player Pettis Norman is no more. He died at 86. Norman passed away peacefully at his home. His family was with him. He played for the Cowboys in the 1960s. Norman also played for the San Diego Chargers. He was a businessman and civil rights advocate after football. Norman's contribution to sports and society is remembered.

title: Ahead of its release, 'Ramayana' earned Rs 1,000 cr with its first look. How?
content: The first look of Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana, produced by Prime Focus Studios, has significantly boosted the company's stock market performance. Following the release of the glimpse, Prime Focus' shares soared, increasing its market capitalization by over ₹1,000 crore in just two days. Ranbir Kapoor is also expected to become a part-owner of the production company.

title: Did Zohran Mamdani claim he was Black because of his poor SAT score?
content: For most students, a 2140 SAT score – roughly in the 94th–96th percentile nationally – would be a ticket to top-tier universities. But for Columbia, it fell short. Mamdani’s mother is Indian, and his father Ugandan-Indian, placing him in the highest-scoring demographic pool in admissions. According to Rufo, his score was below the Asian median but likely above the Black median, raising uncomfortable questions about why Mamdani marked “Black” on his form.

title: IND vs ENG: Anderson on Archer's selection chances - 'Feel like you've got to ...'
content: Former England seamer James Anderson suggests including Jofra Archer for the crucial Lord's Test against India after their Edgbaston defeat. Archer, returning from a long absence, is deemed ready by coach Brendon McCullum. England eyes team changes, considering Gus Atkinson and Jacob Bethell, though Bethell won't replace primary spinner Shoaib Bashir.

title: Parl panel quizzes aviation brass: MPs seek updates on AI-171 crash probe
content: A Parliamentary Panel questioned aviation officials about the Air India plane crash. The meeting included airline and airport representatives. The discussion focused on fees and regulations. The Air India CEO, Campbell Wilson, attended. The crash in Ahmedabad killed around 270 people. The AAIB is investigating, retrieving data from black boxes. Experts from various organizations are assisting.

title: BJP demands apology from Kharge for ‘objectionable’ remarks against Murmu & Kovind
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge for allegedly using derogatory language against President Droupadi Murmu and former President Ram Nath Kovind during a public rally. Kharge's remarks questioning the BJP's motives behind appointing tribal and Dalit Presidents have sparked outrage. The BJP demands a public apology and accuses the Congress of an anti-Dalit and anti-Adivasi mindset.

title: July Full Moon 2025: When and where to watch the Buck Moon in India
content: The Buck Moon will grace India's skies on July 10, 2025, peaking early on July 11. Visible nationwide, this full moon coincides with Guru Purnima, blending natural beauty with spiritual significance. Named for the time when male deer grow new antlers, it symbolizes renewal and growth, offering a unique celestial event for skywatchers and spiritual seekers alike.

title: Larsa Pippen drops massive update about her big day with new beau Jeff Coby
content: Larsa Pippen, Scottie Pippen's ex-wife, has revealed details about her relationship with Jeff Coby, a professional basketball player. She shared that they are on a positive path and hinted at engagement plans, discussing her preferred diamond cuts. Larsa was particularly touched by Coby's family-oriented nature, citing an instance where he was teaching his niece mathematics.

title: Zero attendance, full salary: Madhya Pradesh cop gets paid without working for 12 years
content: A Madhya Pradesh constable managed to draw a full salary for 12 years without ever reporting for duty after being appointed in 2011. Due to a communication lapse, his absence went unnoticed until a pay-scale review in 2023 revealed the fraud, during which over Rs 28 lakh was credited to his account.

title: IND vs END: Who can get Gill out at Lord's? Stuart Broad, Jos Buttler pick
content: Stuart Broad and Jos Buttler have identified a potential weakness in Shubman Gill's technique, despite his recent dominant form. They suggest Jofra Archer, with his ability to nip the ball back, could trouble the Indian captain in the upcoming Lord's Test. Buttler recalls Archer dismissing Gill in the IPL with a similar delivery, offering England a possible strategy.

title: Karnataka Congress churn returns: Fresh calls for DK Shivakumar as CM, 2 MLAs go public
content: Renewed calls for DK Shivakumar to become Karnataka's Chief Minister have surfaced, despite Congress leadership affirming Siddaramaiah's continuation in the role. Two Congress MLAs publicly supported Shivakumar, hinting at internal tensions. Senior leader Tanveer Sait emphasized the need for leadership change, while MLA CP Yogeshwar asserted district MLAs' unity behind Shivakumar.

title: Bharat Bandh: Will govt offices be closed on July 9? What we know so far
content: A nationwide Bharat Bandh on July 9, 2025, called by 10 central trade unions and farmers’ organisations, will protest against government policies deemed "anti-worker" and "pro-corporate." While schools, colleges, and government offices are expected to remain open, disruptions in banking, public transport, and postal services are likely. Power sector employees and farmers are also participating. In Bihar, a separate bandh over voter list revisions may add to the unrest, causing further regional disruptions.

title: Nishikant Dubey doubles down; cites 2007 'Wikileaks document' to target Raj Thackeray
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey escalated his feud with MNS chief Raj Thackeray, sharing a "Wikileaks" document alleging Thackeray is inciting Marathi-Hindi tensions for political gain before Mumbai's municipal elections.

title: 'He has been so worried': Ailing sister hails Akash Deep’s heroics at Edgbaston
content: Akash Deep's remarkable 10-wicket haul against England was made even more poignant by the revelation of his sister's battle with stage three colon cancer. Akhand Jyoti Singh, diagnosed in April 2025, shared how Akash supported her during her treatment while playing in the IPL.

title: Man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing wife, her sister
content: The First Additional District and Sessions Court in Davangere convicted him after finding him guilty of the double murder

title: Residents complain of rampant garbage dumping along Rajiv Gandhi Salai
content: They say piles of waste can be found on service lanes, below foot overbridges and streetlights, and on vacant lots on the roadside. They demanded that a comprehensive action plan be developed to maintain cleanliness in the localities

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court denies anticipatory bail to Indore cartoonist over ‘derogatory’ caricatures of Modi, RSS
content: In the FIR registered at Indore in May, Hemant Malviya was accused of showing the PM and the RSS in an ‘undignified manner’, maligning the image of the outfit, disturbing communal harmony, and hurting religious sentiments

title: Officials told to complete e-KYC, facial authentication for beneficiaries by July 10
content: Complete first phase of Take-Home Ration distribution to pregnant and lactating women by July 15, says Eluru Collector

title: RJD leader Charupara Ravi passes away
content: He has served as vice-chairman of Rubber Board and on the director boards of Travancore Devaswom Board and KSRTC

title: CBI arrests ‘key operative’ of cyber fraud syndicate targeting U.K. and Australian citizens
content: The syndicate’s call centre, operating under the name FirstIdea, was found to be technologically sophisticated, enabling cross-border anonymity and large-scale victim targeting

title: MVA stages walkout over delay in Leader of Opposition appointment
content: Opposition parties accuse Mahayuti government of undermining democratic norms; Speaker assures decision soon

title: Indian Navy signs pact with BEL to boost maritime domain awareness and coastal security
content: The project is expected to bring in an integrated approach to data collation, analysis and information sharing amongst stakeholders

title: IIT-M and Hyundai’s innovation centre seeks to cut production cost of hydrogen fuel
content: The centre, coming up on the IIT-M Discovery Campus in Thaiyur, will seek to develop indigenous technologies to be able to produce and use hydrogen as a green fuel. It is set to be fully functional in two years

title: People repenting their decision to elect Congress govt., says Bommai
content: The BJP MP has said that the people are cursing the govt. as both the CM and Deputy Chief Minister are engrossed in a tussle for power forgetting welfare work

title: Woman kills husband for using ‘Thalliki Vandanam’ money to buy alcohol
content: According to the police, the woman identified as Ramadevi allegedly gave water laced with poison to her husband and when he fell unconscious, she throttled him to death.

title: Malayali nurse Nimisha Priya may be executed on July 16, say unconfirmed reports
content: Though a few online and television media houses reported the development, there was no official confirmation yet from her family members or the representatives of the Save Nimisha Priya Action Council, which had initiated legal and other measures secure her release from prison

title: Motorable roads within 48 hours of digging, say guidelines
content: In cases of defective restoration or failure by the implementing agency to rectify the same, the performance guarantee shall be forfeited, and the work will be carried out by the LSGI at the agency’s expense

title: Amid talk of leadership change, Karnataka CM, Dy. CM to hold talks with Rahul Gandhi, Kharge in Delhi
content: Despite gag orders from the high command, State Congress leaders continue to make statements on the leadership issue, causing embarrassment to the party

title: Denial of timely, unfettered access to medical records violates right to life, says consumer panel
content: Access to one’s medical records — whether physical or digital — is indispensable not only for seeking second opinions and ensuring continuity of care, but also for facilitating effective grievance redressal, says panel

title: National Herald case: Enforcement Directorate opposes arguments of accused persons
content: ED accuses Sonia and Rahul Gandhi of money laundering in National Herald case, arguing transaction was a sham

title: Rights panel steps in to address alleged contamination of well water near temple
content: The PCB and temple committee have assured that water contamination near the temple will be permanently resolved once the new waste treatment plant becomes operational

title: Commuters hit hard by private bus strike in Ernakulam
content: Around 1,300 private buses stayed off the roads in Ernakulam, causing hardship to daily commuters, as part of a token strike, according to the All Kerala Bus Operators Association

title: Power tussle deepens at Kerala University as V-C issues instructions to bypass Registrar in governance
content: While Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar reported for duty on the basis of the Syndicate decision and has resumed handing files, interim Vice-Chancellor Ciza Thomas has declined to accept or process any document routed through him

title: PCB issues closure notices to erring units near Thevara-Perandoor, Edappally canals
content: 88 apartment complexes, commercial buildings, and offices face action for not setting up adequate wastewater treatment facilities

title: Kurnool police conducts ‘Operation Campus Safe Zone’
content: Superintendent of Police Vikrant Patel says that sale of cigarette and any tobacco related products is banned within 100 yards of schools, colleges and other educational institutions.

title: Private bus strike near total in Thrissur
content: Offices and schools remained open, prompting commuters, including students and employees, to rely heavily on KSRTC and private vehicles to reach their destinations.

title: Ganja peddlers travelling in trains targeted to check smuggling from AOB region
content: Instructions have been given to check all the passenger and express trains coming from Odisha, says EAGLE chief

title: Trains won’t be allowed to move if 42% BC quota is not approved by Centre: Kavitha
content: Telangana Jagruthi president asks why Rahul Gandhi is not advising Revanth Reddy to issue a GO on 42 % reservation to BCs

title: BJP government suppressing Opposition's voice, says Patwari; stages protest against FIR
content: Jitu Patwari faces FIR for allegedly forcing man to make fake claims, sparking political controversy in Madhya Pradesh

title: Don’t let TNSTC buses cross four toll plazas in south Tamil Nadu, Madras High Court directs NHAI concessionaires
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh directs the DGP/HoPF and IG south zone to deploy adequate police force to prevent law and order problem

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Many of you can become astronauts, walk on Moon: Shubhanshu Shukla tells students at NESAC
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla interacts with students from Meghalaya and Assam, sharing experiences from the ISS and encouraging future astronauts

title: Kudumbashree’s  fisheries clusters in three more districts this fiscal
content: Number of producer groups in districts where clusters currently exist to be increased to 10 each. New clusters will be set up in Kollam, Alappuzha, and Malappuram districts

title: Controversial YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra invited for promotion of Vande Bharat, seen travelling along with BJP leaders in Kerala
content: The YouTuber was invited by the Indian Railways when the second Vande Bharat was introduced in Kerala and she travelled along with  invited guests, including BJP leader and the then Union Minister V. Muraleedharan and the then BJP State president K. Surendran

title: MUV safari to be resumed in Idukki within 15 days: Collector
content: District witnesses protests by various political parties over sudden ban. Collector says tourists’ safety is of utmost importance

title: Madras High Court grants bail to actors Srikanth and Krishna in drug case
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar directs them to appear before the investigating officer daily for a period of two weeks after their release from prison

title: Hyderabad | Retired Army officer loses ₹1.2 lakh in 10 minutes after downloading APK file to pay traffic challan
content: Authorities clarified that government agencies, including the Transport Department, do not circulate APK files for enforcement or fine collection

title: Shivamogga woman’s death following ‘ritual to ward off evil forces’ shocks village; people demand action against ‘godmen’, ‘godwomen’
content: Geetha, 55, collapsed on Sunday night, allegedly after being beaten up by Asha, 45, as part of the ritual to “drive away evil forces” near the temple of Chowdeshwari in the village

title: High-decibel fun and dark thrills await Tamil television and OTT viewers
content: If you are looking for a riot of high-decibel fun and fast-paced guesswork to liven up your Sunday afternoons, Sound Party adds a vibrant twist to the lineup of Tamil television game shows

title: Rare Great Hornbill sighting in Ezhimala sparks hope for biodiversity
content: A male bird was spotted in the coastal belt of Kakkampara, near Ezhimala, an area far from its usual forested habitats

title: X says government ordered blocking of Reuters handle; no intention to block, says IT Ministry
content: A spokesperson for the IT Ministry said the government has not issued any fresh blocking order on July 3, 2025 and has no intention to block any prominent international news channels including Reuters and ReutersWorld

title: Prosumers, vendors slam draft renewable energy regulations
content: Proposals to restrict the Net Metering System to 3 kW, imposition of grid support charge of ₹1 per unit exported to the grid, and re-designation of ‘peak hours’ draw sharp criticism.

title: Samastha affiliate plans stir against additional school hours in Kerala
content: The future course of action would be declared at a public convention to be held at the Kozhikode Town Hall at 10 a.m. on July 10, say association office-bearers

title: March to Bengal secretariat by non-teaching staff in schools stopped by police
content: the agitating Group C and Group D employees continued with their demonstration, demanding an appointment with the Chief Minister or the state Chief Secretary

title: Daughter entitled to equal share in Hindu Undivided Family, says Kerala HC
content: The daughter of a person from the Hindu community who died after December 20, 2004 acquires coparcenary rights by birth and is entitled to equal share among all legal heirs, noted the court.

title: "Shocked": Mamata Banerjee After Man In Bengal Gets Assam Tribunal Notice
content: Alleging that it was a systematic assault on democracy, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday hit out at the BJP after a Foreigners' Tribunal in Assam served a notice to a farmer from West Bengal's Coochbehar, declaring him an illegal migrant.

title: Poll Body Says May Complete Bihar Roll Revision Exercise Before Deadline
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has expressed confidence that the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in Bihar will be completed well ahead of the July 25 deadline, based on the progress recorded up to 6 P.M. on Tuesday.

title: Dozens Involved In UK Post Office Scandal 'Contemplated Suicide': Report
content: Some 59 people caught up in a faulty accounting software scandal at British Post Office branches contemplated suicide, according to a public inquiry report.

title: Berlin Says China Targeted German Plane With Laser Over Red Sea
content: Berlin on Tuesday said the Chinese military had targeted a laser at a German aircraft participating in an EU-led mission to protect marine traffic in the Red Sea.

title: Goldman Sachs Hires Former UK PM Rishi Sunak As Senior Adviser
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said Rishi Sunak, the former UK prime minister, has rejoined the firm as a senior adviser.

title: Karnataka School Headmaster Dies By Suicide Over Financial Stress: Cops
content: A government school headmaster in Udupi district died by suicide on Tuesday morning, allegedly due to financial stress, police said.

title: E-Commerce Platforms, Online Payments Abused For Terror Financing: Watchdog
content: Global terror financing watchdog FATF on Tuesday cited the February 2019 Pulwama terror attack, which killed 40 CRPF personnel.

title: "X Exploited Technicalities...": Centre Refutes "Press Censorship" Charge
content: The government today refuted microblogging platform X's claim that the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology issued a fresh blocking order on July 3 against 2,355 accounts including international news agency Reuters and Reuters World.

title: Man Dies After Getting Sucked Into Plane Engine At Milan Airport
content: A man was sucked into an aircraft engine on the taxiway at Milan Bergamo Airport in Italy on Tuesday morning.

title: Opposition Raises Law And Order Question After Punjab Businessman Shot Dead
content: The Aam Aadmi Party-led Punjab government is facing a barrage of questions and the heat from the Opposition after a businessman was shot dead in Abohar in Fazilka district Monday.

title: Man Slits Girlfriend, Her Friend's 6-Month-Old Baby's Throats In Delhi
content: A man in Delhi walked into a house where his girlfriend was staying. The couple had been fighting for a few days, and the woman was staying at her friend's home.

title: Chennai Cocaine Case: Conditional Bail Granted To Actors Srikanth And Krishna
content: In a significant development in the Chennai cocaine case that has rocked the Tamil film industry, actors Srikanth and Krishna have been granted conditional bail by the Madras High Court.

title: '7 Months, No Chargesheet': Manipur High Court Orders NIA To Give Report On Jiribam Massacre Probe
content: The Manipur High Court has directed the National Investigation Agency (NIA) to submit a "detailed progress report" on the Jiribam killings, in which three women and three children belonging to the Meitei community were killed by Kuki Hmar insurgents.

title: Video: Speeding Hayabusa Crashes Into Delivery Boy In Mysuru, Both Die
content: As seen in the CCTV footage, a speeding Hayabusa bike hits a Zomato delivery bike rider, riding along the roadside and drives for several meters before it skids and crashes.

title: Video: Locals Form Human Chain Across Maharashtra Waterfall To Rescue 7 Men
content: A group of seven got stranded across the strong current of stream in Maharashtra, prompting locals to launch a rescue operation.

title: Ahead Of Polls, Bihar Cabinet Says Women's Quota In Jobs Only For State Residents
content: The Bihar cabinet decided that the 35 per cent quota for women in government jobs will now be restricted to only permanent residents of the state.

title: Maharashtra Man Rapes Woman Multiple Times On Pretext Of Marriage, Arrested
content: Police have arrested a 26-year-old man from Bhiwandi in Maharashtra's Thane district on the charge of raping a woman multiple times on the promise of marrying her, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Missing Teen Found Dead With Multiple Stab Wounds In Field In UP: Police
content: A day after a 16-year-old boy went missing, his body was found with multiple stab wounds in a field near his village in the Nakur area, the police said on Tuesday.

title: Iran President Faces Backlash For His "Soft" Stance On US
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian came under fire after voicing support for renewed talks with the United States, with critics accusing him of being "too soft" in the wake of last month's attacks on the country.

title: Laser attack in Red Sea: Berlin accuses China of targeting German aircraft, summons envoy
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read more 10 baby girl names that mean “sunshine” 10 must-visit libraries in Delhi with a rich cultural legacy Bollywood actress’ tattoos and their meaning Genelia D’Souza with kids Riaan and Rahyl .

title: Red Sea attack turns deadly: 3 killed as Houthis strike Liberian ship
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read more 10 must-visit libraries in Delhi with a rich cultural legacy Bollywood actress’ tattoos and their meaning Genelia D’Souza with kids Riaan and Rahyl .

title: PPF update: Has interest rate been revised? Key benefits and rules investors should know
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce and can navigate the complexities of the business world .

title: Cousins felt 'misled' after Falcons drafted Penix
content: QB Kirk Cousins said in an episode of the Netflix series "Quarterback," which premiered Tuesday, that he felt "a little bit misled" when the Falcons drafted Michael Penix Jr. in the first round of the 2024 draft.

title: Banchero, Magic agree to $239M rookie max deal
content: Magic star Paolo Banchero has agreed to a five-year, $239 million maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $287 million, his agent told ESPN.

title: Burrow: Home burglary altered Batmobile plans
content: Bengals QB Joe Burrow said on the latest season of the Netflix show "Quarterback," released Tuesday, that last December's home burglary made him change his mind about purchasing a replica Batmobile.

title: Pacers confirm Haliburton won't play next season
content: The Indiana Pacers confirmed what was expected: that star point guard Tyrese Haliburton will miss the entire 2025-26 season after surgery to repair a torn right Achilles tendon.

title: Brown brings 'championship pedigree' to Knicks
content: The Knicks officially hired Mike Brown as their head coach, turning to the two-time NBA Coach of the Year after firing Tom Thibodeau.

title: Ball excited about 'great situation' with Cavaliers
content: Lonzo Ball doesn't have to worry about rehabbing from a knee injury for the first time in a couple of seasons and is excited about his offseason trade to the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Padres slugger Machado gets 2,000th career hit
content: The Padres' Manny Machado got his 2,000th career hit Monday night against the Diamondbacks, with a single in the fourth inning.

title: Elder Chavez defends son arrested by ICE agents
content: Former world champ Julio Cesar Chavez is set to defend his same-name son, who was arrested by U.S. immigration agents at his Los Angeles home for overstaying his visa and lying on a green card application.

title: Who are the NFL's best DTs? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions, from quarterback to cornerback and everything in between.

title: Free agency superlatives: Best, worst, underrated moves
content: Which deals will impact the title race? Which will leave teams in regret by Christmas? Insiders make their picks.

title: Potential MLB trade proposals for Paul Skenes, Ronald Acuña Jr. and Byron Buxton
content: You won't be seeing these stars on the trade block this year -- but what would it take to land them if they were?

title: Ranking all 32 NFL teams based on WR, RB and TE talent: Who's No. 1? Who's No. 32?
content: Which teams have the best skill position talent around their quarterback? We stacked all 32 from worst to first.

title: Power Rankings: Storm up, Aces down and no time to panic for New York
content: The defending champ opened the season with nine straight wins. But it has lost six of the past nine games.

title: 2025 MLB draft guide: One big question and latest intel for all 30 teams
content: Who will the Nationals take No. 1? Who is atop your team's board? Kiley McDaniel lays it all out as draft week arrives.

title: USMNT built foundation of pride, aggression at Gold Cup
content: Spanish soccer expert Graham Hunter followed the USMNT at the Gold Cup, and he saw the foundations being laid for Mauricio Pochettino's vision.

title: Sources: Madrid ask LaLiga to delay opener
content: Real Madrid have asked LaLiga for their league opener against Osasuna to be rescheduled because of their involvement in the FIFA Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: Source: Newcastle agree $75M deal for Elanga
content: Newcaslte have agreed a £55 million deal with Nottingham Forest for winger Anthony Elanga, a source has told ESPN.

title: UEFA snub Madrid over Mbappé, Rüdiger appeal
content: UEFA has rejected Real Madrid's appeal to overturn the disciplinary sanctions handed to Antonio Rüdiger, Kylian Mbappé and Dani Ceballos for "improper conduct."

title: 'No doubt' Wrexham reach Premier League - CEO
content: Wrexham's chief executive has "no doubt" the club will make the Premier League and believes overseas tours -- like the one the club is about to embark on in Australia and New Zealand -- will help future-proof the team.

title: Kylian Mbappé drops PSG harassment claim
content: Kylian Mbappé has dropped the legal proceedings he started this year against Paris Saint-Germain for moral harassment, according to AP sources.

title: Fluminense want 'game of chess' in Chelsea semi
content: Fluminense are relishing their role as the Club World Cup's underdogs ahead of Tuesday's semi-final against Chelsea, with manager Renato Gaucho embracing an "us against the world" mentality that has carried the Brazilian side to an improbable run.

title: Liverpool resumes training amid Jota tributes
content: Liverpool players reported back for preseason training on Tuesday, five days after the death of forward Diogo Jota.

title: In 'flow' Spain put Belgium coach on brink of tears
content: Alexia Putellas helped Spain find their flow against Belgium to leave Red Flames coach Elísabet Gunnarsdóttir wanting to cry after being on the end of a 6-2 loss to the world champions.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Belgium have no answer to Spain's late onslaught
content: Spain produced a scintillating second half performance to romp to a 6-2 victory over Belgium. Here's what else you need to know from Euro 2025 action.

title: Midyear boxing awards: Best KO and fighter, top fight, biggest disappointment and more
content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on what boxing has delivered thus far this year -- good and bad.﻿

title: From WrestleMania moves to showing off his jump shot: How Pete Carroll is rebuilding Raiders culture
content: Carroll's competitive nature and fun-loving spirit is palpable, and the Raiders are hoping their new approach will translate to wins.

title: Running back rankings: Who are the most reliable TD scorers?
content: From Jahmyr Gibbs and Derrick Henry to Bijan Robinson, we rank the running backs based on the most dependable at finding the end zone.

title: Wrexham's Australia and NZ tour diary: Welcome to Melbourne
content: Wrexham have landed! The Welsh club owned by Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney have arrived in Melbourne to begin their preseason tour Down Under.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye move for Javi Guerra
content: Valencia midfielder Javi Guerra is the subject of interest from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'I never doubted him': F1 celebrates Nico Hülkenberg's long-overdue first podium
content: In a 15-year F1 career, Nico Hülkenberg had never tasted podium champagne. That changed at Silverstone, an achievement celebrated up and down pit lane.

content: welterweight boxer Jack Catterall won his debut by technical decision over Harlem Eubank . a cut caused by a clash of heads ended the fight prematurely . his departure from 140 pounds makes room for dalton Smith to enter the rankings at No. 10 .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .
